ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: EVERYONE at FES should take this course, or one like it, even if you are in the natural science side. an understanding of the social sciences and real local issues is critical to being an effective and sensitive policymaker, forester, etc.

Carol Carpenter is one of the best teachers this school has to offer. She brings a completely different way of thinking about development and the environment, and nurtures analytic skills that are unparalleled by any other professor. She is an asset to the school.
Carol's lectures and the readings
Selection of readings and class discussion.
the way it breaks down definitions of policy otherwise taken for granted.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The material is great, but some of it takes FOREVER to get through. also, the comparative analyses didn't always serve a better purpose than the thesis sentences, though sometimes they helped add to understanding.
Some room for critique of the readings. Thesis sentences do not allow one to explore alternative ways of thinking.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: both extremely available.
the TA was excellent, very available and helpful during office hours
Excellent.
extremely helpful and engaging.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I'm working on large-scale policy, so this sort of course is critical to at least trying to make sure my head doesn't end up stuck in the clouds. this should be a required course for any UN/World Bank types.
should be a mandatory course for everyone at the school

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: to gain an understanding of local dynamics
Because Carol Carpenter is a life changing professor.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes and more
yes, definitely
Yes!
More than I could have wished for.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: yes and more
yes
Totally.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: work groups were discussion section leaders... but we mostly wrote our own comparative analyses and then just came together to lead discussion.
getting other perspectives on the readings

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: do the readings! but try and study smart, because they will take you a very. long. time.
keep up and participate in class, don't miss class
You have to read and re-read the assigned papers to get the maximum from this course. Don't let your critical reasoning be subdued however. Keep questioning what you are being told.
